data.name: Toothpaste problem
data.description:
COVID life is boring.

So, Tom starts thinking mundane things.

One thing that he wonders is: "how many days will this toothpaste tube last me?"

A toothpaste tube depletes as Tom uses it (obviously).

An example toothpaste tube, that is partly depleted, is represented as a string:
```
"||||||||........."
```

The ```|``` represents one unit of toothpaste left in the tube.  The ```.``` represents an empty space in the tube.

Let ```n``` be the amount of units of toothpaste that Tom uses, per day.  Assume he brushes twice per day.

How many days will the toothpaste tube last?

Example 1:

```toothpasteCalc("||||||||.........", 5)``` should return 1

After first day, the tube looks like this:

```"|||.............."```

The tube would only have 3 units left, after which Tom must throw it away, since it's not enough for the 2nd day.

Example 2:

```toothpasteCalc("|||||||||...", 2)``` should return 4

After 4 days, Tom would have used 8 units of toothpaste.  The tube would only have 1 unit left, after which Tom must throw it away, since it's not enough for the 5th day.

Check basic test cases for more examples.


NOTE: Not all information in this problem statement is necessary to complete this kata! ;).

NOTE: Usage per day will always be greater than 0.

NOTE: The toothpaste tube string will always be greater than 0 in length.
